class.name: PackedVector2Array
class.description: An array specifically designed to hold [Vector2]. Packs data tightly, so it saves memory for large array sizes.

constructor.name: PackedVector2Array
constructor.description: Constructs a [PackedVector2Array] as a copy of the given [PackedVector2Array].

constructor.name: PackedVector2Array
constructor.description: Constructs a new [PackedVector2Array]. Optionally, you can pass in a generic [Array] that will be converted. [b]Note:[/b] When initializing a [PackedVector2Array] with elements, it must be initialized with an [Array] of [Vector2] values: [codeblock] var array = PackedVector2Array([Vector2(12, 34), Vector2(56, 78)]) [/codeblock]

method.name: append
method.description: Appends an element at the end of the array (alias of [method push_back]).

method.name: append_array
method.description: Appends a [PackedVector2Array] at the end of this array.

method.name: bsearch
method.description: Finds the index of an existing value (or the insertion index that maintains sorting order, if the value is not yet present in the array) using binary search. Optionally, a [param before] specifier can be passed. If [code]false[/code], the returned index comes after all existing entries of the value in the array. [b]Note:[/b] Calling [method bsearch] on an unsorted array results in unexpected behavior. [b]Note:[/b] Vectors with [constant @GDScript.NAN] elements don't behave the same as other vectors. Therefore, the results from this method may not be accurate if NaNs are included.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clears the array. This is equivalent to using [method resize] with a size of [code]0[/code].

method.name: count
method.description: Returns the number of times an element is in the array. [b]Note:[/b] Vectors with [constant @GDScript.NAN] elements don't behave the same as other vectors. Therefore, the results from this method may not be accurate if NaNs are included.

method.name: duplicate
method.description: Creates a copy of the array, and returns it.

method.name: fill
method.description: Assigns the given value to all elements in the array. This can typically be used together with [method resize] to create an array with a given size and initialized elements.

method.name: find
method.description: Searches the array for a value and returns its index or [code]-1[/code] if not found. Optionally, the initial search index can be passed. [b]Note:[/b] Vectors with [constant @GDScript.NAN] elements don't behave the same as other vectors. Therefore, the results from this method may not be accurate if NaNs are included.

method.name: has
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the array contains [param value]. [b]Note:[/b] Vectors with [constant @GDScript.NAN] elements don't behave the same as other vectors. Therefore, the results from this method may not be accurate if NaNs are included.

method.name: insert
method.description: Inserts a new element at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array ([code]idx == size()[/code]).

method.name: is_empty
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the array is empty.

method.name: push_back
method.description: Inserts a [Vector2] at the end.

method.name: remove_at
method.description: Removes an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize
method.description: Sets the size of the array. If the array is grown, reserves elements at the end of the array. If the array is shrunk, truncates the array to the new size.

method.name: reverse
method.description: Reverses the order of the elements in the array.

method.name: rfind
method.description: Searches the array in reverse order. Optionally, a start search index can be passed. If negative, the start index is considered relative to the end of the array. [b]Note:[/b] Vectors with [constant @GDScript.NAN] elements don't behave the same as other vectors. Therefore, the results from this method may not be accurate if NaNs are included.

method.name: set
method.description: Changes the [Vector2] at the given index.

method.name: size
method.description: Returns the number of elements in the array.

method.name: slice
method.description: Returns the slice of the [PackedVector2Array], from [param begin] (inclusive) to [param end] (exclusive), as a new [PackedVector2Array]. The absolute value of [param begin] and [param end] will be clamped to the array size, so the default value for [param end] makes it slice to the size of the array by default (i.e. [code]arr.slice(1)[/code] is a shorthand for [code]arr.slice(1, arr.size())[/code]). If either [param begin] or [param end] are negative, they will be relative to the end of the array (i.e. [code]arr.slice(0, -2)[/code] is a shorthand for [code]arr.slice(0, arr.size() - 2)[/code]).

method.name: sort
method.description: Sorts the elements of the array in ascending order. [b]Note:[/b] Vectors with [constant @GDScript.NAN] elements don't behave the same as other vectors. Therefore, the results from this method may not be accurate if NaNs are included.

method.name: to_byte_array
method.description: Returns a [PackedByteArray] with each vector encoded as bytes.

operator.name: operator !=
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if contents of the arrays differ.

operator.name: operator *
operator.description: Returns a new [PackedVector2Array] with all vectors in this array inversely transformed (multiplied) by the given [Transform2D] transformation matrix, under the assumption that the transformation basis is orthonormal (i.e. rotation/reflection is fine, scaling/skew is not). [code]array * transform[/code] is equivalent to [code]transform.inverse() * array[/code]. See [method Transform2D.inverse]. For transforming by inverse of an affine transformation (e.g. with scaling) [code]transform.affine_inverse() * array[/code] can be used instead. See [method Transform2D.affine_inverse].

operator.name: operator +
operator.description: Returns a new [PackedVector2Array] with contents of [param right] added at the end of this array. For better performance, consider using [method append_array] instead.

operator.name: operator ==
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if contents of both arrays are the same, i.e. they have all equal [Vector2]s at the corresponding indices.

operator.name: operator []
operator.description: Returns the [Vector2] at index [param index]. Negative indices can be used to access the elements starting from the end. Using index out of array's bounds will result in an error.
